excerpt: A delicious and hearty vegan version of the classic meatball sub sandwich.
instructions: First, make the meatballs. Mix together the mashed chickpeas, ground flax seeds and water until well combined.
Add the parsley, bread crumbs, thyme, oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper and mix until well combined.
Form the mixture into meatballs, about 1 inch in size.
Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs and cook for about 5 minutes per side, until crispy and browned on the outside.

While the meatballs are cooking, make the tomato sauce. Mix together the crushed tomatoes, garlic powder, onion powder, basil, oregano and salt and pepper in a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat until simmering.
Once the meatballs are cooked, add them to the tomato sauce and stir to coat.
To assemble the sandwich, preheat the oven to 375ÂºF. Slice the sub rolls in half and place them on a baking sheet.
Spoon the meatballs and sauce onto the rolls and sprinkle with vegan mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with fresh basil leaves.
